examples: Free coffee is one of the perks of the job.

entries.meaning: (video games) A bonus ability that a player character can acquire; a permanent power-up.

verbs.description: perk (third-person singular simple present perks, present participle perking, simple past and past participle perked)

entries.meaning: (transitive, informal) To make (coffee) in a percolator or a drip coffeemaker.
(intransitive, informal) Of coffee: to be produced by heated water seeping (“percolating”) through coffee grounds.

adjectives.description: perk (comparative more perk, superlative most perk)

examples: My ragged rontes all shiver and shake,
As doen high Towers in an earthquake:
They wont in the wind wagge their wrigle tailes,
Perke as Peacock: but nowe it auales.

verbs.description: perk (third-person singular simple present perks, present participle perking, simple past and past participle perked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make trim or smart; to straighten up; to erect; to make a jaunty or saucy display of.
examples: And perks his ears, and stamps and scolds aloud

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To appear from below or behind something, emerge, pop up, poke out.
examples: The heads of plants above the crack’d ground perk:

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) To exalt oneself; to bear oneself loftily.
examples: For whereof commeth thys hypocrisie in the popedome, that men shall preache free will, merits, and satisfactions, and set vp their bristles in suche wise, and beare themselues in hande that they may come perking before God, yea and preace thither lyke shamelesse strumpets.

verbs.description: perk (third-person singular simple present perks, present participle perking, simple past and past participle perked)

examples: He is a tall, thin, bony man, with an interrogative nose, and little restless perking eyes, which appear to have been given him for the sole purpose of peeping into other people’s affairs with.

description: From Middle English perken, from Old Northern French perquer.

verbs.description: perk (third-person singular simple present perks, present participle perking, simple past and past participle perked)

examples: Then sir, let me say, that Mineruas owle was proude, for perking vnder [h]ir golden target  […]
